article_text: Seth Chandler is one of America’s foremost insurance-law experts, and his blog has been home to some of the most rigorous, empirically grounded, and in-depth analysis of the Obamacare rollout in the past few months. Today, he has an important piece on the homepage about the enormous problems with the way Obamacare handles small-business health coverage, and the wave of cancellations, risks of severe adverse selection, and overall irrationality of the system that threatens small employers and their millions of workers in the coming year. The small-business problem is one of the most significant of the many enormous problems facing Obamacare in the coming year. Be sure to read it.

article_summary:
The small-business problem is one of the most significant of the many enormous problems facing Obamacare in the coming year.
Seth Chandler is one of America’s foremost insurance-law experts, and his blog has been home to some of the most rigorous, empirically grounded, and in-depth analysis of the Obamacare rollout in the past few months.
Be sure to read it.
Today, he has an important piece on the homepage about the enormous problems with the way Obamacare handles small-business health coverage, and the wave of cancellations, risks of severe adverse selection, and overall irrationality of the system that threatens small employers and their millions of workers in the coming year.
